header.title: The Scroll of Set, Issue Number 79, Volume XI-5
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Black Magic

central_thesis: The Scroll of Set explores fundamental Setian philosophical concepts, particularly the nature of subjective and objective reality, the conscious mind's unique position outside cosmic equilibrium, and the practical application of these insights for individual Xeper (self-creation). It presents Greater Black Magic as 'awareness manipulation' and outlines an intuitive learning process emphasizing appropriate effort, visualization, and a constructive attitude to foster personal growth and mastery, all within the framework of Setian psychecentric intelligence.

structure_content.chapter_title: Subjective/Objective Theory/Fact by K. Michael Ogle II°, DarkStar Pylon
structure_content.summary: This article proposes an alternate perspective on subjective/objective realities, defining 'objective' as direct sensory data and 'subjective' as internally generated information. It asserts that Greater Black Magic is fundamentally 'awareness manipulation.' Ogle critiques the concept of 'objective truth' in Black Magic Chapter 1, advocating for 'theory' instead. Michael Aquino's annotations contextualize these ideas within Platonic philosophy and the unique Setian view of the conscious mind as being outside cosmic equilibrium.

structure_content.chapter_title: Learning About Learning: An Intuitive Exploration of the Learning Process by Robert Robinson I°, DarkStar Pylon
structure_content.summary: Robinson presents seven interconnected principles for an intuitive and creative human learning process, aiming to enhance personal development and magical practice. These principles include Appropriate Effort, Representation (creating and refining mental images), Quality of Excellence (striving for efficient performance), Visualization/Imagery (detailed mental rehearsal), Reality (accurate self-assessment), the Pleasure Principle (leveraging enjoyment), and Living Creatively (attention, concentration, positive attitude, and constructive discipline).

structure_content.chapter_title: The Book of Coming Forth by Night: Random Notes by Stephen E. Flowers III°, Bull of Ombos Pylon
structure_content.summary: This section discusses the concept of a 'Satanic Age' as a necessary personal evolutionary phase or 'Inferno Period' for some individuals, distinct from linear æonic progression. It explores astral lore related to the Draco constellation and Polaris, examines the relevance of the Slavonic Book of Enoch to Dr. Dee's Enochian system, and elaborates on the Setian understanding of psychecentric intelligence, identifying Set with this 'god-making faculty' of consciousness.

structure_content.chapter_title: Movie Review: Return to Oz by Glinda
structure_content.summary: A metaphorical review of the film 'Return to Oz' from a Setian perspective, using it as an allegory to illustrate the subjective and creative nature of reality and magic. It emphasizes that 'true magic is where you find it - and where you yourself create it,' relating the Oz narrative to personal experience and individual will within a magical context.

key_concepts.definition: The process of shaping and manipulating one's awareness. This includes practices like forming a 'body of light,' assuming god-forms, and 'astral creation' through transferring life-force into subjectively-created images or words.

Objective information originates from sensory interaction with the central nervous system. Subjective information is produced internally, either in response to objective data or spontaneously. The adult mind perceives images and concepts, which are 'objective information cemented within a matrix of subjective information.'

A process separate from physical brain functions like information registration. It is an 'amorphous, fluid state' that can be shaped and manipulated through Greater Black Magic for personal evolution.
The conscious mind is unique, inherently existing outside the equilibrium and symmetry of the cosmos. While it can function within nature, it often does so in a non-initiated state for humanity.

The Setian concept of self-creation or becoming. It implies a non-equilibrium, time-dependent process, analogous to Prigigone's 'Physics of Becoming' and reflected in the kinetic nature of the inverted pentagram.

A necessary personal evolutionary progression or 'purification' phase where an individual confronts and burns away 'Judeo-Christian dross' to become a true Setian. It is a personal rather than linear æonic concept.

The essence of consciousness, which by definition is independent of the mechanical universe. Set is understood as this intelligence, the 'active, aware, 'god-making faculty' of consciousness' that creates reality.

Symbolically represented by the space between the Setian inverted pentagram and its surrounding circle. It signifies the potential into which true creation can take form, drawing parallels to Goethe's Mephistopheles as a shadow figure and Mallarmé's concept of 'lack' for poetic creation.

practical_system.description: The Scroll of Set outlines a system of personal evolution and magical practice centered on the manipulation of individual awareness and disciplined self-development towards Xeper. Greater Black Magic is defined as the shaping and manipulation of awareness. The intuitive learning process, applicable to all forms of 'magic,' involves seven principles: 1. Appropriate Effort (efficient energy use). 2. Representation (creating and refining mental images of desired activity). 3. Quality of Excellence (striving for efficient, satisfying performance). 4. Visualization/Imagery (detailed mental rehearsal). 5. Reality (accurate self-assessment and acceptance). 6. The Pleasure Principle (leveraging enjoyment for motivation). 7. Living Creatively (cultivating attention, concentration, positive attitude, and constructive discipline with maintained self-awareness). This system fosters continuous self-refinement and a deep understanding of subjective/objective reality.
tools: Self-assessment and honest objective feedback (mirrors, audio-visual recordings, facilitators, coaches)
Expansion of the attention field (maintaining self-in-picture of activity and environment)
rituals: Awareness Manipulation (e.g., forming 'body of light,' assuming god-forms)
Astral Creation (e.g., telesmic images, sigils, transferring awareness/life-force)
Destruction Rituals (focused on achieving 'devastating, destructive, or effective' outcomes)
Magical Working (maintaining emotional and intellectual detachment for focus and spontaneous response)
Satanic Age / Inferno Period (a personal purification process)

relevant_quotes.text: Processes of Greater Black Magic (GBM) can be readily interpreted within the framework of awareness. Subjectively the awareness seems to be in an amorphous, fluid state. But it can be shaped and manipulated.
Hence the truth referred to cannot be an objective truth; it must be a theory.

The Setian hypothesis is that the conscious mind is unique in being outside the equilibrium and symmetry of the cosmos, though it does have the capability of functioning within nature and, in the case of non-initiated humanity, usually does.
As I see it, all learning is interrelated and magical in both the most basic and the highest senses of the term.
The only true god is that of the consciousness itself - that which exists objectively, and that which exists as the Gift of that entity in the human psychosomatic complex.
If Set is Understood to be the origin of the principle or essence of the psyche, i.e. its Form/First Principle/Neter, then individual human psyches may be Understood as particularizations of it.
true magic is where you find it - and where you yourself create it.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue is highly relevant for Setian practitioners as it deepens the philosophical understanding of core tenets like subjective/objective reality and psychecentric intelligence, refining concepts from Aquino's 'Black Magic.' It provides a structured, intuitive framework for personal development applicable to magical practice, contextualizes the Temple of Set within broader occult traditions (e.g., historical Satanism, Enochian lore), and offers practical methodologies for achieving Xeper through awareness manipulation and self-mastery. It bridges theoretical philosophy with actionable personal growth strategies.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Primarily Initiates of the Temple of Set and practitioners of Black Magic. It appeals to those seeking a deeper philosophical and technical understanding of Setianism, its practical application in personal evolution (Xeper), and methods for enhancing magical abilities and self-awareness within an occult framework. It also addresses individuals interested in the historical and comparative aspects of Setian philosophy.
